normalised: rental agreements: don't be a bunty aur babli in the property game!

unnormalised: Rental Agreements: Don't Be a 'Bunty Aur Babli' in the Property Game!
normalised: mumbai landlords, listen up! and tenants too! making a rental agreement isn't just some formality. think of it as your property's aadhar card.

unnormalised: Mumbai landlords, listen up! And tenants too! Making a rental agreement isn't just some formality. Think of it as your property's "aadhar card."
normalised: too many folks are still doing handshakes and vague promises. big mistake! get everything in writing — rent amount (rupees twenty five thousand? rupees fifty thousand?), maintenance charges, even who's responsible for fixing that leaky tap.

unnormalised: Too many folks are still doing handshakes and vague promises. Big mistake! Get everything in writing – rent amount (Rs. 25,000? Rs. 50,000?), maintenance charges, even who's responsible for fixing that leaky tap.
normalised: recently, a case went to the bombay high court because a simple rupees ten thousand dispute escalated. save yourself the trouble and legal fees.

unnormalised: Recently, a case went to the Bombay High Court because a simple Rs. 10,000 dispute escalated. Save yourself the trouble and legal fees.
normalised: remember, a solid agreement protects both tenant and landlord. include clauses about lock-in periods (six months? one year?), security deposit refunds, and what happens if sharmaji decides to adopt a great dane in his one b h k.

unnormalised: Remember, a solid agreement protects both tenant and landlord. Include clauses about lock-in periods (6 months? 1 year?), security deposit refunds, and what happens if Sharmaji decides to adopt a Great Dane in his 1BHK.
normalised: think of it as insurance against property drama. your agreement should clearly state how many months' advance notice is required before either party terminates the agreement.

unnormalised: Think of it as insurance against property drama. Your agreement should clearly state how many months' advance notice is required before either party terminates the agreement.
normalised: don't be a bunty aur babli thinking you can outsmart the system. get it done right! websites like nobroker offer ready-made templates to help you get started.

unnormalised: Don't be a 'Bunty aur Babli' thinking you can outsmart the system. Get it done right! Websites like NoBroker offer ready-made templates to help you get started.
